sources.title: Youth Aflame (1945) VINTAGE GRINDHOUSE
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Producer:  J.D Kendis
Directors: Elmer Clifton, Lewis D. Collins
Stars: Joy Reese, Kay Morley, Michael Owen, and Johnny Duncan

Sisters Katy and Laura are about to hit the dating scene, which isn't smiled upon by their widowed father. Soon Laura starts going around with a bad guy while Katy and her friends start a "Jive" club where they can listen to music and drink milk. However, the club gets into trouble when someone spikes the milk. Re-released by Social Service Pictures in 1959 as "Hoodlum Girls."

TRIVIA: Johnny Duncan played Robin the Boy Wonder in the 15-chapter serial "Batman and Robin" released in 1949 by Columbia Pictures, a sequel to the 1943 serial "Batman."

metadata.Plot: Katy White, is at death's door in an emergency hospital but is hanging on long enough to tell her story. In flashback, Katy tells of her widowed father , a bank guard trying to raise two teen-age daughters...Katy the nice girl and her sister, Laura the not-quite-nice girl. Katy tries to guide her sister away from bad company, but isn't having much success. Al, Laura's hoodlum boyfriend, asks her to steal her father's gun.She does so. Meanwhile, under the guidance of Helen Clark, a kindly policewoman, the better-supervised kids open up a JIVE Club in order to keep off of the Mean Streets and not drift into juvenile delinquency. Joy and Laura join the club but Laura only in order to keep late hours with Al. But Joy is keeping a watchful eye on Laura.
metadata.Actors: Joy Reese, Warren Burr, Kay Morley
